text: A cell suspension or suspension culture is a type of cell culture in which single cells or small aggregates of cells are allowed to function and multiply in an agitated growth medium, thus forming a suspension. Suspension cultures are used in addition to so-called adherent cultures. The cells themselves can either be derived from homogenized tissue or from another type of culture. ==See also== *Bio-MEMS *Cell adhesion **Cell adhesion molecule ==References== Category:Cell biology Category:Cell culture
title: Cell suspension
